binding:binding.name: Network Binding
binding:binding.description: The Network Binding can be used for device presence detection and to determine network device health
binding:binding.author: Marc Mettke, David Graeff

parameter.name: allowSystemPings
parameter.label: Allow system pings
parameter.description: Allows or disallows to use system pings next to the java integrated ping functionality. On windows the system ping works more reliable most of the time.

parameter.name: allowDHCPlisten
parameter.label: Listen for dhcp requests
parameter.description: Usually a device requests an IP address in an IPv4 network with the help of DHCP as soon as it enters a network. If we listen to those packets, we can detect a device presence even faster. You need elevated access rights (see readme) for this to work.

parameter.name: cacheDeviceStateTimeInMS
parameter.label: Cache time in ms
parameter.description: The result of a device presence detection is cached for a small amount of time. Be aware that no new pings will be issued within this time frame, even if explicitly requested.

parameter.name: arpPingToolPath
parameter.label: ARP ping tool path
parameter.description: If your arp ping tool is not called arping and cannot be found in the PATH environment, you can configure the absolute path / tool name here
